item.title: Report E-2024110135
item.description:
Report E-2024110135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SAFETY-KLEEN SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4320
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading an IBC into a vehicle. The forklift driver punctures the side of the container spilling ~75 gals of waste. The team immediately started efforts to contain the spill and minimize the amount release from the puncture container. Spill was contained with absorbent pads and socks, release was mitigated by tilting the IBC to stop the flow of waste. Emergency response team was contacted and started the cleaning process and transferring the remainder waste to a new container.

item.title: Report E-2024110055
item.description:
Report E-2024110055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-28
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 28, 2024, four (4) 1-gallon jugs of paint were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and contents of the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the site. The damaged pails and all impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2024110017
item.description:
Report I-2024110017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-07T12:22:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-02
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer had Google Pixel 4 cell phone plugged into powerport at seat when it began to swell. Customer alerted Flight Att6ndant who had customer bring phone back to Aft Galley while instructing another Flight Attendant to obtain the fire containment bag. Flight Attendants added water to fire containment bag and placed cell phone into bag. Phone was swelling and exhibiting some sparking.
